body_html:
The same network is used for the two kinds of installed pytorch. And the performing environment is the same, too. The only difference is the installing method.
CUDA is and ordinary convolution operations are used. Cuda mode is certainly adopted. I am sure the cuda8.0 and cudnnv6 is successfully installed.

I follow the official instructions:
export CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=[anaconda root directory]
conda install numpy pyyaml mkl setuptools cmake gcc cffi
conda install -c soumith magma-cuda80
python setup.py install

Could you tell me how to make sure if cuDNN and MKL are complied with? @apaszke
